nl: Suppose $f$ is continuous in a region $\Omega$. Prove that any two primitives of $f$ (if they exist) differ by a constant.
lean:
∀ (f F₁ F₂ : ℂ → ℂ) (Ω : Set ℂ) (h0 : Nonempty Ω) (h1 : IsOpen Ω) (h2 : IsConnected Ω) (hf : ContinuousOn f Ω)
  (hF₁ : DifferentiableOn ℂ F₁ Ω) (hF₂ : DifferentiableOn ℂ F₂ Ω)
  (hdF₁ : ∀ x ∈ Ω, deriv F₁ x = f x) (hdF₂ : ∀ x ∈ Ω, deriv F₂ x = f x)
  : ∃ c, ℂ, ∀ x, F₁ x = F₂ x + c
candidate: ∀ (h : ContinuousOn f Ω), ∀ p₁ p₂, HasPrimitive f p₁ → HasPrimitive f p₂ → ∃ c, p₁ - c = p₂
imports:
import Mathlib

open Complex Filter Function Metric Finset
open scoped BigOperators Topology
